body: I definitely think so. I also think that in these cases the permaban for alts should only be if that alt was used for evading the rules. Clearly JG's purpose was much more than just modding more guilds, so if it is indeed his alt I don't think it's fair to permaban it in this case. If the alt was used only to evade something then yeah, a permaban makes sense, but that was not the case this time.
body_html: I definitely think so. I also think that in these cases the permaban for alts should only be if that alt was used for evading the rules. body:
https://ruqqus.com/+HijackedGuilds/post/6370/current-hijack-situation-update-in-hitlerwasright/l4rm

More on my thoughts there.

One scenario is that you created an old account, became a GM, and left. You come back a while later, you've forgotten about your previous older account, and now are active with 10 guilds. I don't think that's malicious intent; that's just someone forgetting about their alt.
body_html:
https://ruqqus.com/+HijackedGuilds/post/6370/current-hijack-situation-update-in-hitlerwasright/l4rm

body:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
> Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all?

If the sole purpose of the alt was to evade the limit, then *maybe*. But otherwise definitely not.
body_html:
Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all?

If the sole purpose of the alt was to evade the limit, then maybe. But otherwise definitely not.

guild.description: A place to discuss suspended accounts. Also acts as a memorial.
guild.description_html: A place to discuss suspended accounts. Also acts as a memorial.
guild.name: uslashremoved

parent.body:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
parent.body_html:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

post.body: Even though the main account is supposed to only be 7 days, it looks like this was a permanent ban and his guilds were given away. Pretty similar to DGK and jason and Klenny, looks like the admins just used this as an opportunity to get rid of him because they don't personally like him.

post.title: @JosephGoebbels banned for using alts to bypass the 10 guild limit

body: Sieging should only be for situations where the mod has been inactive for a significant amount of time.  This, where the mod was banned, should be treated differently in order to prevent takeover by hostile users.  Give it to the highest-karma active account or have the admins hold it until one of the actual users (read: has positive karma) users asks to take over.  The fact that things have gone the way they have and the admins are actively defending their activity proves that this was a deliberate action.
body_html: Sieging should only be for situations where the mod has been inactive for a significant amount of time. This, where the mod was banned, should be treated differently in order to prevent takeover by hostile users. Give it to the highest-karma active account or have the admins hold it until one of the actual users (read: has positive karma) users asks to take over. The fact that things have gone the way they have and the admins are actively defending their activity proves that this was a deliberate action.

guild.description: A place to discuss suspended accounts. Also acts as a memorial.
guild.description_html: A place to discuss suspended accounts. Also acts as a memorial.
guild.name: uslashremoved

parent.body: Sieging should only be for situations where the mod has been inactive for a significant amount of time.  This, where the mod was banned, should be treated differently in order to prevent takeover by hostile users.  Give it to the highest-karma active account or have the admins hold it until one of the actual users (read: has positive karma) users asks to take over.  The fact that things have gone the way they have and the admins are actively defending their activity proves that this was a deliberate action.
parent.body_html: Sieging should only be for situations where the mod has been inactive for a significant amount of time. This, where the mod was banned, should be treated differently in order to prevent takeover by hostile users. Give it to the highest-karma active account or have the admins hold it until one of the actual users (read: has positive karma) users asks to take over. The fact that things have gone the way they have and the admins are actively defending their activity proves that this was a deliberate action.

post.body: Even though the main account is supposed to only be 7 days, it looks like this was a permanent ban and his guilds were given away. Pretty similar to DGK and jason and Klenny, looks like the admins just used this as an opportunity to get rid of him because they don't personally like him.

post.title: @JosephGoebbels banned for using alts to bypass the 10 guild limit
